main_definition: A part of a garment that covers the arm from the wrist to the shoulder, often extending beyond the fingers.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Part of clothing for covering arms
meanings_and_examples.example: The light blue sleeve on my shirt is cozy and warm.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A sheath or case used to hold a knife, sword, etc.
meanings_and_examples.example: He placed his dagger in its leather sleeve for safekeeping.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The fold of fabric at the back of a shirt
meanings_and_examples.example: She ironed out the crease on her dress sleeves to make them look neat.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A compartment or pocket in clothing for carrying objects
meanings_and_examples.example: The jacket had large pockets, also known as sleeves, that could fit my phone and keys.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Metaphorical term used to describe the act of covering up mistakes or faults
meanings_and_examples.example: He tried to put a sleeve over his error by quickly changing the subject.
